intro: Canthium stellulatum, commonly known as the star-leaf spurge, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves, which are divided into several lobes resembling a star. It produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in clusters, often with a distinctive cyathium structure. Canthium stellulatum is typically found in arid or semi-arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils.
